citations.narrative:
There is no documented Contingency Plan in place. Failure to develop and document a contingency plan could result in a
delayed response to emergencies and injury or loss of animal life, property, or business. Exhibitors must develop,
document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and
care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster.
Correct by developing and documenting a contingency plan by April 15, 2023.

Several areas of the main hoofstock yard are in disrepair, resulting in sharp points/edges in primary enclosures where
animals can injure themselves.
- Two windows along the back side of the main barn are framed in aluminum molding that has loosened and bent so that
sharp and jagged metal edges extend into the animal area.
- There are two smaller shelters within the main hoofstock yard where fence boards have fallen and the sharp ends of
nails and screws are protruding outward so that they may be easily encountered by the animals contained within the yard.
Sharp and jagged metal edges can cause physical injury to an animal when encountered. Correct by ensuring the outdoor
housing facilities are structurally sound and maintained in good repair, to protect the animals from injury and to contain
the animals. Correct by March 31, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
